ODER 0.99.8

Finds overlapping junctions and annotates ERs as exonic, intronic, intergenic, some combination or none of those

Source: R/annotatER.R
annotatERs.Rd

Looks at junctions passed in to find any overlaps and adds them in along with other information as metadata columns. Then uses a gtf file or a Txdb passed in to generate a genomic state and then labels each ER as to whether they are exonic, intronic, intergenic on none

annotatERs(
  opt_ers,
  junc_data,
  gtf_path,
  txdb = NULL,
  chrs_to_keep = c(1:22, "X", "Y", "MT"),
  ensembl = TRUE
)

Arguments

opt_ers

optimally defined ERs (the product of the ODER function)
junc_data

junction data that should match the ERs passed into opt_ers
gtf_path

a gtf file with exon data
txdb

txdb object, if one is not entered a gtf file needs to be
chrs_to_keep

chromosomes to keep in genomic state (in NCBI format i.e. 1,2,3...22,X,Y,MT)
ensembl

logical variable to say whether the gtf file entered is from ensembl, the default is true

Value

annotated ERs

Examples

# \dontshow{
url <- recount::download_study(
    project = "SRP012682",
    type = "samples",
    download = FALSE
) # .file_cache is an internal function to download a bigwig file from a link
# if the file has been downloaded recently, it will be retrieved from a cache

bw_path <- ODER:::.file_cache(url[1])
gtf_url <- paste0(
    "http://ftp.ensembl.org/pub/release-103/gtf/",
    "homo_sapiens/Homo_sapiens.GRCh38.103.chr.gtf.gz"
)
gtf_path <- ODER:::.file_cache(gtf_url)
# }

opt_ers <- ODER(
    bw_paths = bw_path, auc_raw = auc_example,
    auc_target = 40e6 * 100, chrs = c("chr21", "chr22"),
    genome = "hg38", mccs = c(5, 10), mrgs = c(10, 20),
    gtf = gtf_path, ucsc_chr = TRUE, ignore.strand = TRUE,
    exons_no_overlap = NULL, bw_chr = "chr"
)

#> [1] "2021-08-24 21:59:02 - Obtaining mean coverage across 1 samples"
#> [1] "2021-08-24 21:59:02 - chr21"
#> [1] "2021-08-24 21:59:02 - chr22"
#> [1] "2021-08-24 21:59:03 - Generating ERs for chr21"
#> [1] "2021-08-24 21:59:04 - Generating ERs for chr22"
#> [1] "2021-08-24 21:59:05 - Loading in GTF..."
#> [1] "2021-08-24 21:59:39 - Obtaining non-overlapping exons"
#> [1] "2021-08-24 21:59:41 - Calculating delta for ERs..."
#> [1] "2021-08-24 21:59:41 - Obtaining optimal set of ERs..."

junctions <- SummarizedExperiment::rowRanges(dasper::junctions_example)
annot_ers <- annotatERs(
    opt_ers = opt_ers[["opt_ers"]], junc_data = junctions,
    gtf_path = gtf_path, chrs_to_keep = c("21", "22"), ensembl = TRUE
)
